column4: now parted magic sees the same partition and says that 124GB is free
there was more than 80GB used before this started
thats the story from beginning to end.  It was originally a NTFS formatted partition
I tried to mount this partition on media/sda5, it says it can't mount it
karc, that site is in a language I can not read
Simpler Question:   Is there a way to restore a partition back to the way it was -yesterday-???
god, who do I have to order a pizza for to get some help with this
someone recommended parted magic under the pretense that it can 'restore' partitions back to the way they were.  So far as I can tell, this is not true
I'll paypal someone $10 right now if someone can explain to me how to fix this in a PM or something
it probably won't buy you a gallon of gas by tomorrow morning, but oh well
what did you break?
I deleted a partition and it somehow changed in size.  From 127GB to 8MB.
I also loaded ubuntu livecd and force mounted the 2nd 127GB partition
if you've not done any writes you can get the data back
so I'm told.  But no one can say how.  Someone recommended parted magic and said it could do the job.  But it appears it can not
you might want to make an exact image of the better part of the drive though.
you just have to put the partition table back to the correct size, or possibly something larger
do I just select the ntfs partition and resize?
can I PM you
i think so
do you have enough space to backup the raw data on the disk?
there is 80GB of data I am trying to recover.  The hdd has plenty of space.  cd's do not

well you might use dd or another imaging software to make a backup.  from there you can try to get the data back.  I'm not sure on how NTFS works.  either way you don't want to accidently corrupt things.
